glsa.title: ImageMagick: Filename handling vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: A format string vulnerability exists in ImageMagick that may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: ImageMagick is a collection of tools and libraries for manipulating a wide variety of image formats.

description.p: Tavis Ormandy of the Gentoo Linux Security Audit Team has identified a flaw in the handling of filenames by the ImageMagick utilities.

impact.p: Successful exploitation may disrupt web applications that depend on ImageMagick for image processing, potentially executing arbitrary code.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All ImageMagick users should upgrade to the latest version:
